content.description: There is two fallen trees blocking potential holds at the top of the climb, resulting in needing to grab the dead, rotting trees themselves to top it.  Not worth doing for obvious reasons but once the trees are gone it could become good.
content.protection: a pad, and luck that you're not the one who finally breaks the fallen trees when using them to top out.
content.location: To the left of the main face of the Kuma area.

content.description: Quite a fun route.  I graded it V6-7 because I felt it was V7 but the crux is consisting of a sloper, which is not my forte, so it may be only V6.  Start with your right hand on an angled ledge and left hand side pulling on the arete that goes up about 5 feet.  Note that the rock on the ground is detached and thus is off route.  Start by make a throw with your left hand to the big sloper and use either spiderman stickyness or my choice of a super high heel hook match on the same sloper to make the move to a slot up and right.  The crux is now over but don't become careless as it is still easy to slip due to the slopping feet holds.  Finish by topping out.Note, if you start one move in, with your left hand already on the sloper, it is a grade easier.
content.protection: a pad.  Make sure not to fall too far from the wall and hit the fallen tree.  But ya'll are some crushers so I know ya'll won't fall :)
content.location: Located on the main face of the Kuma area.  The huge, fallen tree is directly in front of the route.

content.description: Start sitting with right hand on crimp edge and left hand on rightward pointing bulge.  Go straight up and top out while avoiding the rocks that are on your left and right.
content.location: In the pit behind the main face of the Kuma area.

content.description: It's kinda tall but the landing is not bad if well padded.  Start at the bottom of the curvy, vertical crack and follow the crack up into a top out finish.
content.location: The left side of the main face of the Kuma Area.  Easy to identify with the curvy, vertical crack.

content.description: Very fun boulder problem and still requires technique for the grade.  Start sitting with both hands on a nice jug ledge.  Move up and right into the hueco and then finish by topping out from here.The route is called "Cabin Boy" because I had just finished watching "Treasure Planet", a must watch if you haven't already, and couldn't get the line "Cabin Boy" out of my head.
content.location: Down the hill slightly and to the right from the main face of the Kuma Area.  This boulder is between the Kuma area and Portal area.

content.description: This area has a decent sized bloc with a key feature of a huge fallen tree in front of it and a pit formed by boulders on four sides behind it.
